com.jidesoft.action
Interface DockableBarManager

All Superinterfaces:
LayoutPersistence
All Known Implementing Classes:
DefaultDockableBarManager
public interface DockableBarManager
extends LayoutPersistence

DockableBarManager is an interface that has all the necessary methods to manages DockableBars.

Methods in this interface can be categorized into the following categories.

  • Add, remove, show, hide DockableBars.
  • Save/load layout information to/from a persistent storage.
  • Interactive with user allowing user to drag, dock, float, hide, or resize all DockableBars.

      See Also:
      DockableBar

      beginDraggingDockableBar

      void beginDraggingDockableBar(JComponent f,
                              int mouseX,
                              int mouseY,
                              double relativeX,
                              double relativeY,
                              boolean single)
      This method is normally called when the user has indicated that they will begin dragging a component around. This method should be called prior to any dragDockableBar() calls to allow the DockableBarManager to prepare. Normally f will be a DockableBar.

      Parameters:
      f - a component to be dragged
      mouseX - mouse screen location on X direction
      mouseY - mouse screen location on Y direction
      relativeX - percentage location of mouse to the component on X direction
      relativeY - percentage location of mouse to the component on Y direction
      single - drag just one dockable bar or all dockable bars in tabs

      dragDockableBar

      void dragDockableBar(JComponent f,
                     int newX,
                     int newY,
                     int mouseModifiers)
      The user has moved the dockable bar. Calls to this method will be preceded by calls to beginDraggingDockableBar(). Normally f will be a DockableBar.

      Parameters:
      f - component to be dragged
      newX - new mouse location on X direction
      newY - new mouse location on Y direction
      mouseModifiers - mouse modifiers from MouseEvent when dragging

      pauseDragDockableBar

      void pauseDragDockableBar()
      Pause the dragging session of a dockable bar. It simply hide any indication of it's being dragging. dragDockableBar will automatically resume the dragging session.

      endDraggingDockableBar

      void endDraggingDockableBar()
      This method signals the end of the dragging session. Any state maintained by the DockableBarManager can be removed here. Normally f will be a DockableBar.

      beginResizingDockableBar

      void beginResizingDockableBar(JComponent f,
                              int direction)
      This methods is normally called when the user has indicated that they will begin resizing the dockable bar. This method should be called prior to any resizeDockableBar() calls to allow the DockableBarManager to prepare. Normally f will be a DockableBar.

      resizingDockableBar

      void resizingDockableBar(JComponent f,
                         int newX,
                         int newY,
                         int newWidth,
                         int newHeight,
                         int deltaX,
                         int deltaY)
      The user has resized the component. Calls to this method will be preceded by calls to beginResizingDockableBar(). Normally f will be a DockableBar.

      endResizingDockableBar

      void endResizingDockableBar(JComponent f)
      This method signals the end of the resize session. Any state maintained by the DockableBarManager can be removed here. Normally f will be a DockableBar.

      getRootPaneContainer

      RootPaneContainer getRootPaneContainer()
      Gets root pane container. Root pane container is the JFrame, JWindow, JDialog or JApplet where this manager is installed to.

      Returns:
      root pane container

      getMainContainer

      MainContainer getMainContainer()
      Gets the main container. Main container is the container that is in the center of content container except dockable bars.

      Returns:
      main container

      toggleState

      void toggleState(String key)
      Toggle the dockable bar's state. If it's docked, change to floating mode; if it's floating, change to docked mode.

      Parameters:
      key - the key of the dockable bar to toggle state.

      toggleState

      void toggleState(DockableBar bar)
      Toggle the dockable bar's state. If it's docked, change to floating mode; if it's floating, change to docked mode.

      Parameters:
      bar - the dockable bar to toggle state

      getAllDockableBars

      Collection<DockableBar> getAllDockableBars()
      Gets a collection of all the dockable bars. The order of dockable bar in this collection is unpredictable. If you want to get them in the order of being added, use getAllDockableBarNames().

      Returns:
      the collection of all dockable bars
      See Also:
      getAllDockableBarNames()

      getAllDockableBarNames

      List<String> getAllDockableBarNames()
      Gets a list of all the names of dockable bars. You can call getDockableBar(name) to Gets the actual dockable bar. The order of dockable bar name in this list is the same order as they were added. If you want to get all dockable bars and doesn't matter the order, you can use getAllDockableBars().

      Returns:
      the list of all dockable bars

      getDockableBarPopupMenuCustomizer

      DockableBarPopupMenuCustomizer getDockableBarPopupMenuCustomizer()
      Gets the popup menu customizer for DockableBar. When user right clicks on the dockable bar or empty spaces among dockable bar, a popup menu will be shown to allow user hide/show each dockable bars. However if you want to add additional menu items to this popup menu, you can use this customizer to do it.

      Returns:
      popup menu customizer.
      See Also:
      setDockableBarPopupMenuCustomizer(DockableBarPopupMenuCustomizer)

      setDockableBarPopupMenuCustomizer

      void setDockableBarPopupMenuCustomizer(DockableBarPopupMenuCustomizer customizer)

      Parameters:
      customizer -
      See Also:
      getDockableBarPopupMenuCustomizer()

      dockDockableBar

      void dockDockableBar(DockableBar bar,
                     int side,
                     int row,
                     boolean createNewRow,
                     int start)
      Docks the dockable bar at the specified side and row.

      Parameters:
      bar - the dockable bar to be docked
      side - four possible sides
      row - the row index
      createNewRow - true to create a new row at the specified row index. Otherwise uses the existing row.
      start - the starting position, in pixels.

      switchRootPaneContainer

      void switchRootPaneContainer(RootPaneContainer rootContainer)
      Change the root pane container. The root pane container is set as a parameter in constructor of DockableBarManager. However if the content container is moved to another root pane container, you need to call this method to let DockableBarManager know the change.

      We suggest you call saveLayout to a known location before calling this method, then call loadLayout to load the saved layout back after calling to switchRootPaneContainer to make sure dockable dockable bars are laid out correctly in the new root pane container.

      Parameters:
      rootContainer -

      setShowInitial

      void setShowInitial(boolean value)
      A client may specify that the docking layout is to be initialized without showing the window. In this case, the client is responsible for calling showInitial() the first time the window is to be shown.

      Default is true, show the window at the end of initial layout.

      Parameters:
      value -

      isShowInitial

      boolean isShowInitial()
      A client may specify that the docking layout is to be initialized without showing the window. In this case, the client is responsible for calling showInitial() the first time the window is to be shown.

      showInitial

      void showInitial()
      A client may specify that the docking layout is to be initialized without showing the window. In this case, the client is responsible for calling showInitial() the first time the window is to be shown.

      Since:

      getDockableBarFactory

      DockableBarFactory getDockableBarFactory()
      Gets the dockable bar factory. The factory is used in loadInitialLayout() method. If the dockable bar exists in initial layout but not added to DockingManager, the factory will be used to create the dockable bar.

      Returns:
      the dockable bar factory.

      Parameters:

      getContextMenu

      JPopupMenu getContextMenu()
      Gets the default context menu for DockableBarManager. The menu has menu items to show/hide any dockable bar and changes options such as rearrangeable, hidable and floatable.

      Returns:
      the default context menu.

      Parameters:

      setDockableBarAvailable

      void setDockableBarAvailable(String key)
      Makes the dockable bar available.

      Usually all dockable bars are added to DockableBarManager when application is started. However some dockable bars may only be available under certain context. For example, palette toolbar should only be available when editing a GUI form. In this case, you can set the palette to available when GUI form is active. Or else, set it to unavailable.

      Set the bar available will restore the last state of the bar when it is set to unavailable.

      Parameters:
      key - key of dockable bar

      setDockableBarUnavailable

      void setDockableBarUnavailable(String key)
      Makes the bar unavailable.

      Usually all dockable bars are added to DockableBarManager when application is started. However some bars may only be available under certain context. For example, palette bar should only be available when editing a GUI form. In this case, you can set the palette to available when GUI form is active. Or else, set it to unavailable.

      Set the bar unavailable will hide the dockable bar no matter what state it is. However the state will be remembered so that when later it was set to available, that state will be restored. When bar is unavailable, operations to that dockable bar such as showDockableBar, hideDockableBar, etc, will have no effect.

      Please note, the available/unavailable flag will not be saved into the layout file. As a matter of fact, all bars will become available so that their previous position can be saved precisely. So whenever you call saveLayoutData methods, you need to make those bars unavailable again.

      Parameters:
      key - key of dockable bar
